Columbia 16 points, 12 rebounds Jan. 9, 2015 vs. Dowling 14 points, 11 rebounds Feb. 14, 2015 @ Bridgeport 25 points, 11 rebounds Feb. 20, 2015 vs. St. Thomas Aquinas 16 points, 11 rebounds Feb. 21, 2015 vs. Mercy 18 points, 14 rebounds Mar. 6, 2015 vs. Concordia (neutral site) 20 points, 10 rebounds Dec. 30, 2015 @ St. Michael's 11 points, 10 rebounds Feb. 7, 2016 vs. Bridgeport 25 points, 10 rebounds Feb. 19, 2016 vs. LIU Post 20 points, 10 rebounds Feb. 21, 2016 vs. NYIT 15 points, 10 rebounds Nov. 11, 2016 vs. Felician (neutral site) 14 points, 13 rebounds Jan. 2, 2017 vs. Mercy 24 points, 13 rebounds Jan. 4, 2017 vs. St. Thomas Aquinas 11 points, 10 rebounds Jan. 14, 2017 @ Molloy 11 points, 10 rebounds Feb. 25, 2017 @ Roberts Wesleyan 17 points, 14 rebounds Nov. 11, 2017 vs. Nyack (neutral site) 16 points, 10 rebounds Nov. 30, 2017 @ Mercyhurst 25 points, 10 rebounds Dec. 17, 2017 @ Bridgeport 13 points, 11 rebounds Dec. 30, 2017 @ St. Michael's 22 points, 11 rebounds Jan. 14, 2018 vs. NYIT 19 points, 10 rebounds Jan. 19, 2018 @ Molloy 24 points, 15 rebounds Feb. 28, 2018 @ Roberts Wesleyan 22 points, 10 rebounds

2016-17

Played in all 26 games (25 starts) and led the Wildcats to an 11-15 overall record

Led the team in points scored (414) for the third-straight year

Scored her 1,000th career point during a mid-season loss to Saint Anselm

Also led the team in minutes played (819), total rebounds (192) and rebounds per game (7.4)

Second on the team in points per game (15.9), steals (34) and blocks (38)

Scored in double figures 21 times, including seven 20-point games

Logged five double-doubles

Scored a career-high 28 points three times during the year

Turned in an outstanding effort during a 96-84 win over LIU-Post on Jan. 25, as she played all 40 minutes, connected on 10-of-18 shots and totaled 28 points, seven rebounds, seven blocks, five assists and five steals

Played 39 minutes and totaled 26 points and seven rebounds in an 83-78 win over Bridgeport on Feb. 2

Finished the season ranked among the conference leaders in points per game (4th), total points (10th), points per 40 minutes (8th), defensive rebounds (10th), total rebounds (14th), rebounds per game (12th), minutes per game (15th), field goals made (9th), free throws made (8th), blocks (7th), and steals (20th)

Was a one-time ECC Player of the Week selection

Became the first-ever two-time, first-team All-ECC selection from Daemen

2015-16

Played in all 26 games (25 starts) and led the Wildcats to a 9-17 overall record

Led the team in points (432), points per game (16.6), free throws made (112) and free throws attempted (160) for the second-straight year

Also led the team in rebounding (6.3 rpg), blocks (44) and steals (36)

Second on the team in minutes played (793) and minutes per game (30.5)

Scored in double figures 22 times, including nine 20-point games

Logged four double-doubles

Scored a season-high 26 points in a conference road win at LIU Post on Jan. 15

Made 10 free throws in two separate games; 10-13 in home loss against District of Columbia on Dec. 13 and 10-10 in an overtime road loss to Bridgeport on Dec. 20

Recorded season-high four steals in overtime road loss to Bridgeport on Dec. 20

Finished the season ranked among the conference leaders in points per game (T-4th), total points (5th), points per 40 minutes (4th), defensive rebounds (12th), total rebounds (T-17th), rebounds per game (13th), minutes per game (18th), field goals made (T-7th), free throws made (4th), blocks (4th), and steals (T-19th)

Was a one-time ECC Player of the Week selection

First-team All-ECC selection

2014-15

Made an immediate impact by appearing in all 29 games and making 27 starts

Led the team to a 14-15 record and a USCAA Division I national championship

Joined veteran Raeann Stilwell as the only players to average more than 30 minutes per game (30.7) while leading the team in points (411), points per game (14.2), free throws made (100) and free throws attempted (154)

Also finished among the team's top three in field goals made (140 - 2nd), three-point field goals made (31 - 3rd), total rebounds (210 - 2nd), offensive rebounds (57 - 2nd), defensive rebounds (153 - 2nd), rebounds per game (7.2 - 2nd), assists (61 - 3rd), assists per game (2.1 - 3rd), blocks (37 - 3rd) and steals (35 - 2nd)

Scored in double figures 25 times, including six 20-point games

Made her first career start on Dec. 6 in Daemen's home-opener vs. Point Park, responding with her first career double-double (21 points, 10 rebounds) and her first career 20-point game

Erupted for a season-high 25 points and grabbed 11 boards in a conference road win at Bridgeport on Feb. 14

Came off the bench on Senior Day (Feb. 21) vs. Mercy and stuffed the stat sheet with 18 points, a career-high 14 rebounds, four assists, two blocks and two steals

Started all three of Daemen's USCAA national tournament games, averaging 14.3 points and 7.7 rebounds per game while shooting 47-percent from the field and 43-percent from three-point range

Scored 20 points and grabbed 10 caroms in Daemen's USCAA semifinal win over top-seeded Concordia (Ala.)

Scored 11 points and added a career-best five blocks in the USCAA title game vs. Berea (Ky.)

Finished the season ranked among the conference leaders in total minutes (17th), minutes per game (18th), field goals made (11th), three-point field goal percentage (7th), free throws made (6th), offensive rebounds (15th), defensive rebounds (12th), total rebounds (11th), rebounds per game (12th), blocks (11th), total points (8th), points per game (10th) and points per 40 minutes (14th)

Ranked first among all ECC freshmen in scoring average and rebounds per game

Was a six-time ECC Rookie of the Week selection (Dec. 8-14, Dec. 29-Jan.4, Jan. 19-25, Feb. 2-8, Feb. 9-15, Feb. 16-22)

Named a Second Team USCAA All-American

HIGH SCHOOL

2014 graduate of Lancaster High School where she played for the Redskins and coach Marissa Gallo

Earned four varsity letters for basketball

Finished her career as Lancaster's all-time leading scorer with 1,176 points, becoming the first female at the school to eclipse 1,000 career points

Named seventh-team Class AA all-state as a junior and eighth-team as a senior

Was a two-time ECIC Division I Player of the Year and three-time All-ECIC large school selection

Was also a three-time All-Lancaster Bee pick

Earned first team All-Western New York honors as a senior after being a second team as a junior and an honorable mention as a sophomore

PERSONAL INFORMATION

Born Sarah Ann Saba on May 18, 1996 in Buffalo, N.Y.

Daughter of Dave and Mary Beth Saba

Siblings include David

Hobbies include working out and listening to music

Majoring in athletic training

Chose to attend Daemen College because..."of their great athletic and academic programs."
